title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 329-2.4 - Diagnostic coding and rate computation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 329-2.4 - Diagnostic coding and rate computation

State Regulations
(a) Facility shall assign ICD-10 diagnostic and HCPCS/CPT-4 procedure codes for
each visit and shall utilize the claim coding information to assign the
applicable APG. The facility shall use the APG software system to determine the
significant procedure APG, applicable ancillary services APGs and the final
weight for a visit. The APG software system shall incorporate methodologies for
consolidation, packaging and discounting to be reflected in the final weight to
be assigned to the claim. (b) Other
applicable adjustments shall be made by the facility. (c) Bill in accordance with APG requirements
and WCB adjustments submitted for reimbursement to Payer with a copy to
WCB. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
329-2.4

Adopted

New

York State Register December 30, 2015/Volume XXXVII, Issue 52, eff. 12/30/2015

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
